# Draft:Heather Grace Stewart

Heather Grace Stewart (born Heather Katherine Grace)  is a Canadian author, poet, journalist, and screenwriter. She writes under her married name, Heather Grace Stewart, and is known for her poetry collections, romantic fiction novels, screenplays, and contributions to Canadian media.
Early life and education
Heather Katherine Grace was born in Ottawa, Ontario, and raised in Kanata, Ontario. Her first poem was published in her school newsletter when she was five.
In a 2022 interview about her romantic comedy novel, Lucky, she said, "The rural areas in the book are inspired by places I explored when growing up in rural Ontario and Quebec," referencing her childhood experiences.
She attended Queen's University in Kingston, Ontario and graduated with a BA(H) in Arts, Canadian Studies, in 1995. She completed her Graduate Diploma in Journalism at Concordia University in the Spring of 1996.
Career
Grace Stewart moved from Kingston, Ontario to Montreal, Quebec, to study at Concordia University before working as a reporter and associate editor for several national magazines. In April 1996, she met Canadian wildlife photographer Fred Bruemmer and interviewed him over lunch for a term paper. "I so enjoyed listening to his tales of high-risk adventure, I kept making excuses to see him again." Three years later, her interviews resulted in a ''Reader's Digest magazine article.
She began her career as a weekly reporter for NDG’s The Monitor, a community newspaper serving Notre-Dame-de-Grâce, Montreal, where she served as Chief Reporter and columnist from April to September 1996. She later worked as an Associate Editor for Harrowsmith Country Life, Canadian Wildlife Magazine,  Equinox, and WILD! until January 1999.
From 2000 to 2003, Grace Stewart served as Editor-in-Chief of Career Verdict Magazine'', a publication for Canadian law students.
She served as a columnist and member of the Editorial Advisory Board for Queen's University's Queen’s Alumni Review for over 15 years, contributing feature articles and columns. In 2013, she profiled Dr. Balfour Mount—known as the “Father of Palliative Care in North America”—in an article titled “The Last Human Freedom.”
During her freelance years, she contributed articles and photography to several national and international publications, including Reader’s Digest National Geographic Traveler, ''Reader's Digest, The Ottawa Citizen, and Groom'' Magazine.
Grace Stewart's first traditionally published e-book was an illustrated CD-Rom-format book of children's verse entitled Bubble Mud and Other Poems, published by Canadian publisher Electric E-Book Publishing in 2001.
Grace Stewart also authored two illustrated biographies for youth for Jackfruit Press’s Canadian Prime Ministers: Warts & All series. Her titles include Sir Wilfrid Laurier: The Weakling Who Stood His Ground and Kim Campbell: The Keener Who Broke Down Barriers, both written for young readers and praised for their conversational tone and accessible storytelling. CM Magazine reviewed the latter edition, stating, "Stewart has written a smart, sympathetic account of Canada's nineteenth Prime Minister, The Right Honourable Kim Campbell."
In 2012, Queen’s Alumni Review profiled Grace Stewart’s literary achievements, noting her contributions as a longtime columnist and highlighting her five-city reading tour promoting her poetry collection, Carry On Dancing (Winter Goose Publishing). The article described her as a “writer-photographer poet” and praised her critically acclaimed books of adult verse.
In 2022, Grace Stewart was interviewed by NewInBooks about her romantic comedy Lucky, which was inspired by a real-life highway incident involving a piglet. She described her writing process as immersive and quirky, and said she hopes readers feel “joy and a state of calm” after reading her work.
All of Grace Stewart’s published novels have also been released in audiobook format by audiobook publishers Tantor Media and Dreamscape Media. In 2025, Tantor Media contracted Grace Stewart for a four-book audiobook deal for her romcom time travel series,The Timeless Love Chronicles. Book 1, The Love Leap, was released in audiobook format on September 30, 2025.
Grace Stewart has also been profiled in Neomedia newsmagazine for her literary contributions and public lectures. In the summer of 2025, she held a book signing event for The Love Leap and The Ticket at Indigo Books in Pointe-Claire, Quebec and acted as the moderator of their first, invite-only Romance and Fantasy Book Talk author panel.
Advocacy and public outreach
In 2025, Grace Stewart became a vocal advocate for early mammograms and breast cancer awareness following her diagnosis with early-stage breast cancer. She shared her journey through personal videos on Instagram, Facebook and Threads, encouraging early detection and self-advocacy. Montreal radio host Nat Lauzon publicly praised Grace Stewart’s openness and strength, noting their shared experience and surgeon.
That same year, Grace Stewart was quoted in a Yahoo News article about Meta’s use of pirated books to train AI models. The article noted that her novel The Ticket and screenplays The Friends I’ve Never Met and Best Before were among the works scraped without consent. Grace Stewart described how the incident made her feel “livid” and emphasized the personal and professional impact of the theft, stating, “Creators like me deserve respect and fair compensation.”
Personal life
Grace Stewart lives near Montreal, Quebec, with her husband and their child. The couple married in August 2003. In interviews and public posts, Grace Stewart has described her personal interests as including photography, yoga, inline skating, gardening, baking bread, and sampling craft beer.
Bibliography
Stewart has published over twenty works of fiction and poetry. Selected titles include:
* Sir Wilfrid Laurier: The Weakling Who Stood His Ground (2006)
* Kim Campbell: The Keener Who Broke Down Barriers (2008)
* The Friends I’ve Never Met (2014)
* The Ticket (2016)
* Caged (2016)
* Best Before (2021)
* Lucky (2022)
* The Love Leap (2025)
* The Timeless Love Chronicles series (2025–)
Several titles are available in audiobook format through Tantor Media and Dreamscape Media.
